subject: Religion & Spirituality
title: Galileo vs. the Church: What Really Happened
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Galileo vs. the Church: What Really Happened.

hook.text: Galileo wasn't burned. He wasn't tortured. The real story is more complicated and more interesting than the myth.

buildup.text: In 1633, the Church forced Galileo to recant heliocentrism. He spent his last years under house arrest, not a dungeon.

discovery.text: The Church didn't reject all science. It rejected Galileo's claim to interpret scripture. The fight was about authority.

twist.text: Many scientists of the era were priests. The Church funded astronomy. The conflict was political, not anti-science.

climax.text: Galileo became a symbol of science vs. religion. But the real lesson is about power, ego, and who controls truth.

punchline.text: Galileo vs. the Church was about power, not planets. Both sides had egos.

quiz.question: What was the Galileo affair really about?
options: A power struggle over who had authority to interpret truth
